Class Plot

extends JFXWindow
implements Gridable, Clearable

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Plot(java.lang.String title, ResultTable list)
      Creates a plot that automatically tracks and plots the first two columns of a ResultTable.
      Plot(java.lang.String title, ResultTable list, int xData, int yData)
      Creates a plot that automatically tracks and plots a ResultTable (ResultList or ResultStream) object, specifying which two columns to plot.
      Plot(java.lang.String title, ResultTable list, int xData, int yData, int sData)
      Creates a plot that automatically tracks and plots a ResultTable (ResultList or ResultStream) object, specifying which columns to plot but also specifying which column to use to sort the data into separate series.
      Plot(java.lang.String title, ResultTable list, int xData, int yData, java.lang.String seriesName, javafx.scene.paint.Color colour)
      Creates a plot that automatically tracks and plots a ResultTable (ResultList or ResultStream) object, specifying which columns to plot, the name of the data series and its colour.
      Plot(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String xLabel, java.lang.String yLabel)
      Creates an empty plot from the given title, x-axis label, and y-axis label.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Plot

        public Plot(java.lang.String title,
            java.lang.String xLabel,
            java.lang.String yLabel)
        Creates an empty plot from the given title, x-axis label, and y-axis label.
        Parameters:
        title - Title of the plot
        xLabel - X-Axis Label
        yLabel - Y-Axis Lable

      • Plot

        public Plot(java.lang.String title,
            ResultTable list,
            int xData,
            int yData,
            java.lang.String seriesName,
            javafx.scene.paint.Color colour)
        Creates a plot that automatically tracks and plots a ResultTable (ResultList or ResultStream) object, specifying which columns to plot, the name of the data series and its colour.
        Parameters:
        title - Title for the plot
        list - The ResultTable (ResultList/ResultStream) to track
        xData - Column number to plot on the x-axis
        yData - Column number to plot on the y-axis
        seriesName - The name of the data series to create
        colour - The colour to use for the plotted points and line

      • Plot

        public Plot(java.lang.String title,
            ResultTable list,
            int xData,
            int yData,
            int sData)
        Creates a plot that automatically tracks and plots a ResultTable (ResultList or ResultStream) object, specifying which columns to plot but also specifying which column to use to sort the data into separate series.
        Parameters:
        title - Title for the plot
        list - The ResultTable to track
        xData - Column number to plot on the x-axis
        yData - Column number to plot on the y-axis
        sData - Column number to use for sorting into series

      • Plot

        public Plot(java.lang.String title,
            ResultTable list,
            int xData,
            int yData)
        Creates a plot that automatically tracks and plots a ResultTable (ResultList or ResultStream) object, specifying which two columns to plot. Colour and series name automatically chosen.
        Parameters:
        title - Title for the plot
        list - The ResultTable to track
        xData - Column number to plot on the x-axis
        yData - Column number to plot on the y-axis

      • Plot

        public Plot(java.lang.String title,
            ResultTable list)
        Creates a plot that automatically tracks and plots the first two columns of a ResultTable. Column 0 on the x-axis and column 1 on the y-axis. Series name and colour automatically chosen.
        Parameters:
        title - The title of the plot
        list - The ResultTable to track

      • setMaxRange

        public void setMaxRange(double range)
        Sets the max x-axis range to show on the plot. Points that are outside this range from the maximum x-axis value will be removed from the plot automatically.
        Parameters:
        range - The range, set to -1 to disable

      • watchList

        public void watchList(ResultTable list,
                      int xData,
                      int yData,
                      java.lang.String seriesName,
                      javafx.scene.paint.Color colour)
        Set the plot to automatically track and plot a ResultTable object, specifying which columns to plot, the name of the series and its colour.
        Parameters:
        list - The ResultTable to track
        xData - Column number to plot on the x-axis
        yData - Column number to plot on the y-axis
        seriesName - Name of the data series
        colour - Colour of the series (eg try: Color.RED or Color.GREEN, etc)

      • watchList

        public void watchList(ResultTable list,
                      int xData,
                      int yData,
                      int sData)
        Set the plot to automatically track and plot a ResultTable object, split into multiple data series, specifying which columns to plot and which column to use to sort into series.
        Parameters:
        list - The ResultTable to track
        xData - Column number to plot on the x-axis
        yData - Column number to plot on the y-axis
        sData - Column number to use for series sorting

      • createSeries

        public int createSeries(java.lang.String name,
                        javafx.scene.paint.Color colour)
        Creates a new data series, returning its number.
        Parameters:
        name - The series name
        colour - The series colour (eg Color.RED, Color.GREEN, Color.BLUE etc)
        Returns:
        The id of the new series
